messages.messageBody:
--- Elizabeth Chase <lizzirrd@...> wrote:

> Actually, I'd have to decline the 'presidency',
> lol.

Thanks. But it's no democracy. This is thoroughly a
dictatorship, and you can consider me your friendly
neighborhood stormtrooper.

Thanks!

messages.subject: The 'presidiency' Re: [samuraihistory] History/Shotokan Re: new subject
messages.msgSnippet: Actually,  I d have to decline the presidency , lol. My neck would get a crick in it from trying to spot the shinobi come to whup my ...... delicate self. On
messages.messageBody:
Actually, I'd have to decline the 'presidency', lol.


My neck would get a crick in it from trying to spot the shinobi come to whup my ...... delicate self.

On the other hand, List High Master Kitsuno would still be Minister of Security, Deputy LHM (twice removed) would still be
Minister of Literacy (sub-duties include intelligence testing, decorum, grammar, and spelling), and the Grand PoohBah Bryant would
still be the Minister of Accuracy (sub-duties include lightning-quick, knife-pointed sarcasm, in which he excels. Bryant-dono ---
was that your Laurel?).

So, since all things remain the same, who needs a 'president'?

Silly me,

Lizzie






----- Original Message -----
From: Silk Road School
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, December 03, 2004 7:31 PM
Subject: RE: [samuraihistory] History/Shotokan Re: new subject



Date: Thu, 2 Dec 2004 22:56:43 -0800 (PST)
From: james wilson <johntwo8@...>
Subject: Re: History/Shotokan Re: new subject


WOW Miss Chase for new President of samuraihistory forum. GOD BLESS all and
go vote



Poor lad. Who gave you the sublime misapprehension that this was a
democracy?

..And it's a damned good thing too: because with no offense to the lady
in question, and as pleasant as I (for one) find her posts, scholarship does
not flourish in such a democracy.
